info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 11:46AM EDT until April 7 at 12:52AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Muscatatuck River near Deputy affecting Jefferson and Scott Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past several days has caused the river to rise with additional rainfall expected through Sunday.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Muscatatuck River near Deputy.
* WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads are underwater.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 23.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 28.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.5 feet on 04/29/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Sunday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING
